qas.question: Did the crime rate go up or down after the War years?

answers.text: pronounced rise in crime in the years following World War II

qas.question: What was the average murder rate during the 90's?

context: Like many American cities, Philadelphia saw a gradual yet <a0_0>pronounced rise in crime in the years following World War II<a0_0/>. There were <a1_0>525<a1_0/> murders in 1990, a rate of 31.5 per 100,000. There were an average of about <a2_0>600<a2_0/> murders a year for most of the 1990s. The murder count dropped in 2002 to 288, then rose four years later to 406 in 2006 and 392 in 2007. A few years later, Philadelphia began to see a rapid drop in homicides and violent crime. In 2013, there were <a3_0>246<a3_0/> murders, which is a decrease of over 25% from the previous year, and a decrease of over 44% since 2007. And in 2014, there were 248 homicides, up by one since 2013.
